data.title: Edit some missing variable %s
Drawing a sprite with rotation
data.body:
While I was browsing Reddit, I came across a post describing a "fake 3D" method in the game NIUM (thread [here](https://www.reddit.com/r/gamedev/comments/57x7n3/really_cool_fake_3d_in_gamemaker_by_the_creator/)).

This seems like a really cool effect, and I was excited to experiment with it, but as I went into the Godot documentation I realized that there's absolutely no way to draw a sprite on the screen with a given rotation, barring manually manipulating the pixels yourself. While technically, you could achieve the same effect by stacking `Sprite` nodes as a child to the root node (which some people have suggested), this seems like it should be a remarkably inefficient process, as each node is receiving its own callbacks from the engine.

I'd like to request a simple, additional, optional parameter to the [`draw_texture` function family](http://docs.godotengine.org/en/latest/classes/class_canvasitem.html#class-canvasitem-draw-texture) which specifies an angle to rotate the sprite by when drawing it, much like Game Maker has in its `draw_sprite_ext` function.

For the record, when I was looking for a solution to this, I checked for, in order:
- A way to rotate the sprite when drawing it
- A way to make translations independent of rotation when drawing
- A way to rotate the ImageTexture/Texture before drawing it

None of these came out fruitfully, unless I completely missed something.

data.title: Feature Request: TileMap improvements
data.body:
I would like to request a few simple-ish functions for the tilemap class, based on my dabbling with procedural levels.

get_extents():
Returns a rect2 or similar structure that contains the space occupied by non-empty cells. This should be fairly easy to do at at base level, and spares having to write something to loop through all of get_used_cells.

flood_cellsv( vector2 position, tile ID to flood fill, optional array of tile ids which block the flood fill):
flood fills an area from code with the tile id, starting at the vector2 position, the optional array when not present would default to anything other than -1

find_connected( Vector2 position, array of blocking tile IDs):
Breadth-first-Searches the tilemap, starting at the vector position provided, and constrained by the array of tile IDs. Returns an array of reachable positions.

overlay_tilemap(Vector2 position, node)
Takes the node, which should be a tilemap with the same tileset and copies it into the calling tilemap, not adding or deleting anything under empty cells in the copied map.

A chunk of these are maybe a little too specific, but I want to open up some thought about what a few underlying tools could be used for.

data.title: Fix comparison bug with InputEvent
Floating precision
Main screen added by plugin is displayed in all main screens
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Mageia 6
Godot master

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
The screen should only be displayed under its context, not under 2D, 3D, Asset lib and Script.

First screen: plugin disabled
![plugin-disabled](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1289207/19620854/bb911cb8-9885-11e6-82de-9e8d4b3d530e.png)

Second screen: plugin enabled, 2D context
![plugin-enabled](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1289207/19620855/bb915156-9885-11e6-87aa-b4cfc8d5ed1f.png)

Third screen: plugin enabled, Tree-tools context
![plugin-treetools-tab](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1289207/19620856/bb956eda-9885-11e6-8673-7067d9ee6f94.png)

**Steps to reproduce:**
0. If you use Windows, you should copy the `addons` folder in the `godot-dialogtreetools/addons/`. The idea is to set the plugin as a plugin for itself.
1. Download project : https://github.com/StraToN/godot-dialogtreetools
2. Import it in Godot launcher and click "Edit" to run the editor.
3. Go to Project settings, "Plugins" tab and enable the plugin
4. The content of the new Tree-tools context is displayed under all contexts.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
https://github.com/StraToN/godot-dialogtreetools

data.title: Ability to visually parent Controls to a 3D node
data.body:
The ability to visually parent Controls to a 3D (Spatial) node, that is, moving a Control automatically to "follow" a 3D node would be very useful. It surely can be done by code currently, but having it in core would make it easier (and likely faster when there's lots of Controls to move).

This would be useful for player name tags or other kinds of visual information that are "attached" to an object in a 3D world, without requiring a depth-scaled rendered viewport containing the Control.

data.title: HTML5 export audio issue: "Cannot read property 'disconnect' of undefined"
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**

Ubuntu, Godot 2.1

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):

I have a generic "explosion" scene that I add to the main scene to represent an explosion. The explosion scene has a `SamplePlayer` attached. I call a "boom" function on it, which starts a 2s timer and immediately plays a 1.5s sound effect. When the timer is triggered, it removes the scene afterward. This works fine in desktop exports and in the editor, but in the HTML5 export I occasionally see the following stacktrace.

Stacktrace:

```
index.js:1 Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'disconnect' of undefined
  _as_voices.(anonymous function).onended @ index.js:1
```

data.title: Crash when opening or editing a scene with ParallaxLayer
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Godot c23e879, Ubuntu Linux 16.10 (64b)

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
I get a crash when opening a scene containing a parallaxbackground, both when running the project or in the editor. Seems something related to Vector2.
Scene just crashes without any output. If opened in editor, it crashes Godot entirely.
Could be related to #6733 ?

gdb output:

```
Thread 1 "godot" received signal SIGSEGV, Segmentation fault.
0x00007ffff55dbb70 in __dynamic_cast () from /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libstdc++.so.6
(gdb) bt
#0  0x00007ffff55dbb70 in __dynamic_cast () from /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libstdc++.so.6
#1  0x0000555556334f40 in ParallaxLayer::set_motion_scale(Vector2 const&) ()
#2  0x00005555557eb2e1 in MethodBind1<Vector2 const&>::call(Object*, Variant const**, int, Variant::CallError&) ()
#3  0x00005555569a1f41 in ObjectTypeDB::set_property(Object*, StringName const&, Variant const&, bool*)
    ()
#4  0x0000555556976131 in Object::set(StringName const&, Variant const&, bool*) ()
#5  0x0000555556454d6e in SceneState::instance(bool) const ()
#6  0x0000555556456282 in PackedScene::instance(bool) const ()
#7  0x000055555602a089 in MethodBind1RC<Node*, bool>::call(Object*, Variant const**, int, Variant::CallError&) ()
#8  0x000055555696d728 in Object::call(StringName const&, Variant const**, int, Variant::CallError&) ()
#9  0x00005555568ba03b in Variant::call_ptr(StringName const&, Variant const**, int, Variant*, Variant::CallError&) ()
#10 0x00005555556d8d3e in GDFunction::call(GDInstance*, Variant const**, int, Variant::CallError&, GDFunction::CallState*) ()
#11 0x000055555583f6cd in GDInstance::call(StringName const&, Variant const**, int, Variant::CallError&) ()
#12 0x000055555696d897 in Object::call(StringName const&, Variant const**, int, Variant::CallError&) ()
#13 0x00005555568ba03b in Variant::call_ptr(StringName const&, Variant const**, int, Variant*, Variant::CallError&) ()
#14 0x00005555556d8d3e in GDFunction::call(GDInstance*, Variant const**, int, Variant::CallError&, GDFunction::CallState*) ()
#15 0x000055555583f6cd in GDInstance::call(StringName const&, Variant const**, int, Variant::CallError&) ()
#16 0x000055555696d897 in Object::call(StringName const&, Variant const**, int, Variant::CallError&) ()
#17 0x00005555568ba03b in Variant::call_ptr(StringName const&, Variant const**, int, Variant*, Variant::CallError&) ()
#18 0x00005555556d8d3e in GDFunction::call(GDInstance*, Variant const**, int, Variant::CallError&, GDFunction::CallState*) ()
#19 0x00005555558407e5 in GDInstance::_ml_call_reversed(GDScript*, StringName const&, Variant const**, int) ()
#20 0x000055555602665d in Node::_notification(int) ()
#21 0x000055555696b504 in Object::notification(int, bool) ()
#22 0x00005555560246a4 in Node::_set_tree(SceneTree*) ()
#23 0x0000555556024762 in Node::_add_child_nocheck(Node*, StringName const&) ()
#24 0x0000555556024a08 in Node::add_child(Node*, bool) ()
#25 0x00005555558c4b39 in MethodBind1<Node*>::call(Object*, Variant const**, int, Variant::CallError&) ()
#26 0x000055555696d728 in Object::call(StringName const&, Variant const**, int, Variant::CallError&) ()
#27 0x0000555556913fb7 in MessageQueue::_call_function(Object*, StringName const&, Variant const*, int, bool) ()
#28 0x000055555691426a in MessageQueue::flush() ()
#29 0x00005555560485c0 in SceneTree::input_event(InputEvent const&) ()
#30 0x00005555556b5d71 in InputDefault::parse_input_event(InputEvent const&) ()

#32 0x00005555556a4ca0 in OS_X11::run() ()
#33 0x000055555569f5a8 in main ()
```

**Steps to reproduce:**
Run or open any scene with ParallaxLayer (for example the 2D Platformer demo). Instant crash.
I was told by Henkz on IRC that he couldn't reproduce, so this might be related to something in the Ubuntu 16.10 build environment compared to 16.04? If any digging is required, let me know.
Alternatively, creating a new scene, adding a ParallaxBackground, then a ParallaxLayer and changing the scale seems to reliably crash here.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
Platformer 2D demo can trigger this crash.

data.title: Allow relative DynamicFont scaling in Control nodes, without requiring separate resources
data.body:
It would be handy if Control nodes using DynamicFonts could have their text (and only their text) scaled relative to the parent theme, without having to declare new DynamicFonts.

Related to https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/5557 which is also about DynamicFont scaling, but for RichTextLabel.

data.title: Unicode character echo in project path
data.body:
In my project path i have a directory called 'Dveloppement', the first time i launch a project the terminal display a normal output:

```
OPENING:.../Dveloppement/...::Dveloppement::...
```

But the second time it display:

```
OPENING:.../Dveloppement/...::Dveloppement::...
```

Then:

```
OPENING:.../Dveloppement/...::Dveloppement::...
```

And rapidly it can take one minute for display dozens of lines just for the path.
Ubuntu 14.04.

Edit:
workaround: restore editor_settings.tres each time before to launch Godot

data.title: RegEx re-implemented as a module
data.body:
Re-wrote nrex as a module using godot-specific parts and new features:

Removed use of mutable variables in RegEx. RegExMatch is returned instead. Example:

```
var re = RegEx.new()
re.compile("\\w+ (\\w+)")
var match = re.search("Hello world!")
print(match.get_string())
print(match.get_string(1))
```

Output:

```
Hello world
world
```

Added string substitutions. Example:

```
var re = RegEx.new()
re.compile("(\\w+) (\\w+)")
print(re.sub("John Doe", "\\2, \\1"))
```

Output:

```
Doe, John
```

Named groups are now supported. Example:

```
var re = RegEx.new()
re.compile("(?P<greet>\\w+) .+")
print(re.sub("Goodbye World", "You said \\g<greet>"))
var match = re.search("Hello world!")
print(match.get_names())
print(match.get_string("greet"))
print(match.expand("And I said \\g<greet>"))
```

Output:

```
You said Goodbye
[greet]
Hello
And I said Hello
```

Things left on the TODO list: Documentation and making RegEx an exportable resource.

I should also add the warning:
# THIS WILL BREAK EXISTING CODE.

data.title: GDScript fails to export variables properly from within a tool script, whenever a singleton is accessed within that script.
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 10 Pro - Godot 2.1.0.0

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
GDScript fails to export variables properly from a tool script, whenever a singleton is accessed within that script.

Extensive details and how to reproduce here: [Export var bug when using singletons within a tool](http://dfaction.net/godot-export-var-bug-when-using-singletons-within-a-tool/)

data.title: Feature proposal: Time manipulation / Speed mode in Node
data.body:
I would like to have the ability of slow-mo in my games and change it where and when I like (like in some particular events)
Maybe a SPEED member that comes built-in in a Node and other nodes will have the ability to inherit it (like pause mode) and if it reaches 0 it will pause the game 
And maybe the delta argument in the process function will be multiplied by SPEED:

```
func _process(delta):
    var time_passed = delta # delta is actually old delta * speed
```

Or process will have another argument in case you want to know how much time passed in real time:

```
func _process(delta, real_delta):
    var time_passed = real_delta
    var time_passed_in_game = delta
```

Include _fixed_process too.
The thing is it should affect all child nodes and all type of nodes like AnimationPlayer, SamplePlayer, Tween, Physics, Particles etc..
That sounds like it could be done just by implementing something to Node...

data.title: Fix extraneous NULL character on HTML export
Create script Dialog changes extension automatically.
data.body:
Fix on Issue #6878.

I'm assuming that a file or a folder named with a "." is invalid in any system when you change the language of your script. If that is untrue, the fix is literally just taking the "_path_changed(file_path->get_text());" from the original if statement.

EDIT: corrected this case, now it changes the extension regardless of folders names.

data.title: Fix output binary paths for VS project generation
BackBufferCopy does not allow you to use anchor + margins properly
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
x11 64bit, v2.2.alpha.custom

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
When you place an "BackBufferCopy" node in your scene, regardless of your parent anchor and sizes, it wont allow you to set size to match parent sizes.
Currently, you have to manually change the size of the children as anchor+margins are useless.

**Steps to reproduce:**
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6776092/19567649/d25f11cc-96ee-11e6-8f38-836d795ec5f3.png)

Does not use parent sizes.

data.title: Editor interface is broken by Tilemap
data.body:
Linux, 1280x1024, godot 2.1.1

What am I doing:
- create the project and open (editor starts maximized)
- add Tilemap node (all is ok)
- create new tileset for it in its inspector (bingo!)
- move mouse to the center of the window
- ...
- PROFIT

And when I unmaximize the window, UI won't scale itself horizontally anymore (when I resize the window),  it scales only vertically (may be this is the clue?)

After the bug occurred, I can't even move the right pane's splitter to the left, but if I add say node2d to the hierarchy and select it, I can resize the pane as I want (but UI won't fix tho), but upon selecting Tilemap, all reverts back (the resized right panel)

But if I switch from Tilemap to something other and unmaximize the window - UI 'cures' :laughing:

data.title: create script dialog says valid path to visualscript with .gd extension and vice versa
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Fedora 24 Godot master branch at commit 78d97b060a6873a454e710380cb9ef1bde5e4c65

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
when creating a script you choose gdscript for example and type a name with the extension .gd and tells you valid path at the bottom of the dialog. but then if you change that to visualscript it would still say valid path.

**Steps to reproduce:**
create a visualscript and give it name.

![screenshot from 2016-10-20 15-38-53](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6195060/19562140/e28cd94a-96e3-11e6-832d-f174ae1bf311.png)
